subject: statistics
title: Sufficient Statistics
contentHtml: A sufficient statistic is a minimal summary of all the information in a sample that can be used to make inferences about the population.

theorem.statement: \[P(T(x) = t | x) = P(T(x) = t) for all x, t.\]

intuition: A sufficient statistic is a way to summarize the data in a sample that contains all the information needed to make inferences about the population.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, sufficient statistics are used in Bayesian inference and maximum likelihood estimation.
